paper_abstract: In this paper, we shall use the regularized sampling method introduced recently to compute the eigenvalues of Sturm-Liouville problems with nonlocal conditions {-y '' + q(x)y = lambda y, x is an element of [0, 1] chi(0)(y) = 0, chi(1)(y) = 0, where q is an element of L(1) and, chi(0) and chi(1) are continuous linear functionals defined by chi(0)(y) = integral(1)(0)[y(t)d psi(1)(t) + y'(t)d psi(2)(t)], chi(1)(y) = integral(1)(0)[y(t)d phi(1)(t) + y'(t)d phi(2)(t)], where chi(0) and chi(1) are independent, and psi(1), psi(2), phi(1) and phi(2) are functions of bounded variations. Integration is in the sense of Riemann-Stieltjes. A few numerical examples will be presented to illustrate the merits of the method, and comparisons will be made with the exact eigenvalues when they are available. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Computing the eigenvalues of a class of nonlocal Sturm-Liouville problems
